alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 23 at 2:42PM PST until January 24 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Westerly swell of 5 to 7 feet at 17 to 20 seconds will bring an increased risk of sneaker waves to area beaches. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Mendocino Coast, Northern Humboldt Coast and Southwestern Humboldt Counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight.. . * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Long lulls are typical between hazardous sneakers waves, and the ocean may appear relatively calm for up to 30 minutes between larger wave sets.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. there can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
